meanings.definition: The fact or condition of being prevalent; widespread existence or occurrence.
meanings.sent1: The prevalence of smartphones in our society is very high.
meanings.sent2: The prevalence of fast food restaurants makes it easy to grab a quick meal.
meanings.sent3: The prevalence of rainy days during our picnic was quite unfortunate.
meanings.sent4: The prevalence of gossip in the office spread like wildfire.
meanings.sent5: The prevalence of laughter in the comedy club was contagious.

meanings.definition: The quality or condition of being prevalent; superior strength, force, or influence.
meanings.sent1: Her prevalence in the debate team made her a strong contender.
meanings.sent2: The prevalence of his arguments convinced many to change their minds.
meanings.sent3: The prevalence of her baking skills was unmatched in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: His prevalence in the gym was like that of a fitness guru.
meanings.sent5: The prevalence of her leadership was evident in every project she led.
